metadata.title: CVE-2020-10958 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Dovecot before 2.3.10.1, a crafted SMTP/LMTP message triggers anunauthenticated use-after-free bug in submission-login, submission, orlmtp, and can lead to a crash under circumstances involving many newlinesafter a command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10958` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dovecot package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm2').
